author: Kallol Bhattacherjee
text:
Days ahead of his visit to China, Nepal Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli called up Prime Minister Narendra Modi in an attempt to reduce growing strains in India-Nepal ties.

The External Affairs Ministry said, “The Prime Minister emphasised the importance of finding a durable solution to the political problems facing Nepal based on consensus or ‘sahmati’.”

Mr. Oli’s phone call, ostensibly to convey New Year greetings, came days after Nepal concluded an eight-point agreement with China that will secure Nepal’s energy supply through China and reduce its dependence on India. The tensions in India-Nepal ties also spilled into Parliament as Members of the Standing Committee on External Affairs held discussions with Foreign Secretary S. Jaishankar on various aspects of the crisis on December 29. Members who attended the briefing by Mr. Jaishankar said the souring of India’s ties with Nepal would send out a wrong message to other nations of South Asia.
title: Nepal’s Oli rings Modi after deal with China
